alert.note: Alert for Monroe Upper Keys (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Key West (Key West - The Florida Keys)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 16 at 1:05PM EST by NWS Key West
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Upper Keys in Monroe County through 145 PM EST... At 105 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ocean Reef to 5 miles southeast of the East End Of Long Key Viaduct. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jewfish Creek Bridge, Key Largo, Plantation, Teatable Key, Route 1/card Sound, Route 1/card Sound Road Split, Rock Harbor, Upper Matecumbe Key, Windley Key and Ocean Reef. This includes US 1 between mile markers 79 and 109. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
